Description: Sherd of East Greek pottery stand; outside slipped cream; above, frieze of verticals, irregularly set; below, band of rays with double outline; band between and glazed at lower break. Rather large drill hole at right, most probably from a repair.
Producer name: Made by: The London Dinos Group
Curator's comments: The orientation of the piece would seem to be tapering down, to judge from wheelmarks on interior. Many aspects suggest it is of the Aeolian London dinos group, including the micaceous orange fabric.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.80)
